toolPhD 0.1.0

wrapper for correlation calculation

Source: R/cor_df.R
cor_df.Rd

cor_df calculate correlation matrix/stripe for each complete pairs.

cor_df(dat, tar.column = NULL, method = "pearson", nice.format = FALSE)

Arguments

dat

a dataframe, include *only* numeric columns for correlation

tar.column

default is `NULL`, when set to *one string of a column name*, then extract the output only related to this column.

nice.format

default is `FALSE`, when `TRUE`, then arrange with `r2` and subset for the significance one.

metohd

default is 'pearson', 'spearman' and 'sma' is also available

Value

a list of three elements: 1. `r.mat`r matrix, 2.`p.mat` p-value matrix or a dataframe containing `r`,`r2`,`sign`,`p`,`p.value`,`p.sig`.

Author

Tien-Cheng Wang

Examples

# numeric dataframe
cor_df(mtcars[,1:3])
#> Error in cor_df(mtcars[, 1:3]): could not find function "cor_df"
cor_df(mtcars,"cyl")
#> Error in cor_df(mtcars, "cyl"): could not find function "cor_df"
cor_df(mtcars,"cyl",nice.format=T)
#> Error in cor_df(mtcars, "cyl", nice.format = T): could not find function "cor_df"
cor_df(mtcars,"cyl",nice.format=T,method='sma')
#> Error in cor_df(mtcars, "cyl", nice.format = T, method = "sma"): could not find function "cor_df"

# dataframe contains character
cor_df(iris)
#> Error in cor_df(iris): could not find function "cor_df"
cor_df(iris[,-5])
#> Error in cor_df(iris[, -5]): could not find function "cor_df"
